A True German Delikatessen in the heart of Downtown Sanford right around the corner from Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant 117 Magnolia Ave Sanford, FL 32771 Sunday - Thursday: 10 am - 7 pm Friday & Saturday: 10 am - 8 pm Phone: 407-321-2204 ext 3 Order Lunch with Doordash - Free Pick-up View Catering Options ‚Üí Sandwiches View Menu Beer & Wine View Selections Meat & Cheese View Selection About Hollerbach‚Äôs German Market After two years of planning and a lifetime of dreaming, the Hollerbach family followed up on the success of their Willow Tree Caf√© German restaurant by opening Magnolia Square Market in 2011, with the goal of providing personalized, knowledgeable service and premium quality products to the Sanford community and visiting guests. Naturally, our focus is always on imported German products ‚Äì beer and wine from over 50 German breweries and wineries, chocolate, Gummi bears, dry goods, condiments, and many other products from familiar brands such as Haribo, Ritter Sport, Knorr, L√∂wensenf, Maggi, etc. ‚Äì but we also feature in-house prepared meats, a full-service bakery, a lunch counter with a wide assortment of meats and cheeses from quality vendors, a frozen meat section, even some produce‚Ä¶the diversity of products in our little German deli and shop surprises even us sometimes. üòä So drop in sometime for a bottle of beer and a freshly-prepared deli sandwich, pick up a few things to make your own German meals at home, or maybe just have an espresso and a piece of homemade Black Forest Cake while you‚Äôre out exploring Sanford‚Äôs Historic District ‚Äì all of it served with a side of Hollerbach Gem√ºtlichkeit! Bakery Manager/Assistant Store Manager Nike Lengert and Store Manager Jacqueline Zollner Meet Our Market Managers! Meet the Store Manager and  Bakery Manager/Assistant Manager of Hollerbach‚Äôs German Market. Our Manager, Jaqueline, has been with us for over 10 years and has a wealth of experience in the retail industry. She is from Hamburg, Germany and she‚Äôs always on the lookout for new products that remind her of home. Our Bakery Manager/Deli Assistant Manager¬†, Niky Lengert¬†, I started with Hollerbachs in 2002 as a waitress. As the business grew, Linda asked if I wanted to learn to make desserts. I said yes! Ive served, managed the FOH, worked in the bakery, became lead baker and now Bakery Manager. With my love for the company and always thinking and dreaming of the what‚Äôs next,helping to manage the deli was the next step! Together, Jaqueline and Niky bring their knowledge and experience to our market to bring feelings of Gem√ºtlichkeit for every guest. Overview Join Us Renew Your Membership Donate Partner With Us Job Opportunities English Espa√±ol Member Login Donate Search The Latest News & Stories New on Main Street Business Insights: Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant Article Published September 12 , 2023 Author Main Street America Share September 13, 2023 | New on Main Street Business Insights: Hollerbach's German Restaurant | By: Liz Shenk, Manager of Marketing & Outreach | In this week‚Äôs episode of Main Street Business Insights , host Matt Wagner sat down with the CEO of Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant in downtown Sanford, Fla., Christina Hollerbach. In addition to providing an authentic German food and beverage experience to guests, Hollerbach‚Äôs also includes a German market, art gallery, outfitters, and an entertainment venue. In 2019, Hollerbach‚Äôs founded the Hollerbach‚Äôs Has Heart Family Foundation to provide grants to hospitality workers to pursue education and/or business certifications and provided financial relief to hospitality workers throughout the global pandemic. The restaurant was opened in 2001 by Christina‚Äôs parents, Linda and Theo Hollerbach. Christina transitioned into the role of CEO in 2020. As CEO, Christina focuses on the importance of creating a healthy organizational culture by instilling a sense of community among her employees. In her conversation with Matt, Christina discusses how she has created and led a thriving company culture through the pandemic and beyond, her strategies for growth and expansion, and advice for newer Main Street business owners. Listen to their conversation here. Availability: Priority seating is available from Monday to Friday and on Sunday evenings. This service must be arranged at least 24 hours in advance of your visit to ensure we can accommodate your request. 3 Options to Make a Priority Seating Request By Phone: Call us at 407-321-2204 (press option 1) during the following hours: 11 to 6 Sunday through Thursday¬†phone hours 11 to 8 Friday and Saturday phone hours By Email: Send your request to guestservices@hollerbachs.com . Fill out the necessary details, and we‚Äôll handle the rest. Please Note: Priority seating is not a traditional reservation but a way to reduce your wait time upon arrival. While we do our best to accommodate all priority seating requests, seating is subject to availability and cannot be guaranteed. We recommend making your request as early as possible, especially for larger groups or special occasions. We look forward to welcoming you to Hollerbach's and providing a memorable dining experience filled with the best of German cuisine and hospitality. Upon Arrival Check in with the host. The host will confirm your priority seating and inform you when the next table is available. Typical wait times vary depending on the size of your party but average wait is less than 25 minutes. Waiting Options The Lodge Bar: Enjoy a full menu and have a seat at the bar or a table. For parties larger than typical dining groups, Hollerbach‚Äôs is proud to offer two exquisite venues that cater to different group sizes and event types: Hollerbach's Upstairs Venue: Ideal for gatherings of 40-80 guests, this venue offers a spacious yet intimate setting perfect for larger private parties, corporate events, and celebrations. Should thee seek a venue both grand and regal, venture to Knight‚Äôs Hall, perched upon the second floor of Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant. Here, within walls adorned with the splendor of German knights and the charm of a medieval castle, awaits a space designed for the distinguished assembly of up to 26 guests. Summon forth your kinsmen and maidens for a gathering that promises not just merriment but a feast fit for royalty. Whether it be for a stately meeting or a celebratory feast, Knight‚Äôs Hall offers exclusive luncheon rendezvous Monday through Friday, with a mere $250 minimum. Feasts within this hallowed hall are tailored to suit the grandeur of the occasion, with culinary offerings ranging from $34 to $100 per guest. Each dish, inspired by the rich traditions of German cuisine, is crafted to transport thee and thy guests to a time of chivalry and honor. Until then, here are some frequently asked questions to guide you on your planning journey." ‚ùì Frequently Asked Questions Q: What‚Äôs included in the package price? A: Each package includes food, staffing, setup, cleanup, standard tableware, 7% sales tax , and 20% gratuity ‚Äî no surprise fees. Note: Knights Hall experiences follow a separate pricing structure with more elevated, plated or family-style service options. Q: How long can I use the space? A: Most packages include up to 3 hours of event time , with our team handling setup and cleanup before and after. Need more time? Let us know in advance ‚Äî extended time may incur an additional fee to cover staffing and operations. Q: Can I bring in outside vendors? A: Yes! You‚Äôre welcome to bring your own vendors like DJs, florists, or photographers. We also have a preferred vendor list featuring local pros we trust and love working with. We‚Äôre happy to share recommendations. Q: Can I bring my own cake or dessert? A: Most packages include dessert, and our talented in-house bakery team can customize sweets for any occasion ‚Äî from classic German confections to themed creations (with enough notice!). We do allow outside cakes in special cases, like elaborate multi-tier wedding cakes, but all outside desserts must be approved in advance. Q: Can I decorate the space? A: Absolutely! Feel free to bring florals, table runners, signs, and d√©cor to personalize the space. Please note: No sparklers, glitter, confetti, or open flames (except candles in approved holders). Let us know in advance what you‚Äôre planning and we‚Äôll help with setup where possible. Q: Do you offer kid-friendly meals? A: Yes! We can accommodate children with simplified menus and smaller portions. Just let us know how many kids will be attending. Q: Do you accommodate dietary restrictions? A: Yes ‚Äî we can provide vegetarian, gluten-free, dairy-free, and allergy-sensitive options with advance notice. Just include any dietary needs when booking. Q: Is the space ADA accessible? A: Yes, both Knights Hall and Hollerbach‚Äôs Upstairs are fully ADA compliant. Elevator access and ADA-friendly restrooms are available for all guests. Q: What kind of A/V setup do you have? A: We offer flexible audio-visual options for both spaces: Upstairs Event Space : Drop-down projection screen, ceiling-mounted projector, wired microphone, and sound system that can play your own playlist or a curated German one. Knights Hall : 65‚Äù TV for presentations, Bluetooth speaker for music, and cozy audio support for smaller gatherings. Q: What happens if it rains? A: Our Upstairs space includes both indoor and outdoor seating (up to 60 each), but for safety and comfort we recommend limiting events to 80 guests or fewer. The outdoor Biergarten deck will be closed during high wind or rain events , and our team will help adjust your layout as needed. We‚Äôll stay in communication and do everything we can to adapt for weather. Q: Is the event space private? A: Yes. All bookings reserve private or semi-private use of the space based on your group size. You‚Äôll have a dedicated service team for your entire event. Q: Where can guests park? A: Free public parking is available in nearby lots and along surrounding streets. We‚Äôll include parking suggestions and maps in your confirmation email. Q: Where can guests park? And what about travel or accommodations? A: Free public parking is available in nearby lots and along the streets surrounding our location in Historic Downtown Sanford. If you‚Äôre planning for out-of-town guests, we‚Äôve created a helpful Travel & Accommodations Guide with hotel recommendations, parking tips, airport info, and things to do while you're here. Feel free to share the link with your guests! Q: What‚Äôs your cancellation policy? A: We require a credit card authorization to hold your date (no charge at booking). Cancel 7+ days in advance: 25% cancellation fee Cancel within 7 days: refunds are at our discretion Q: Can I schedule a walk-through before booking? A: Of course! We‚Äôre happy to show you around and help you visualize your event. Just reach out through the inquiry form to schedule a tour with Sebastian. Q: What if I don‚Äôt see the right package for my event? A: We‚Äôve got you covered. Sebastian, our Event Coordinator, will work with you to create a custom package that fits your style, group size, and budget. Q: What if I need space for more than 100 guests? A: For groups larger than our upstairs event space can accommodate, Sebastian can help explore options for a full restaurant buyout . He‚Äôll connect with our leadership team to check availability and provide a custom proposal based on your needs, timing, and budget. Just note your group size in the inquiry form and Sebastian will take it from there. Author Hollerbachs Posted on January 5, 2018 January 5, 2018 Categories German Traditions Featured German Immersion Night at the Willow Tree ‚Äì second Tuesday of every¬†month! Sprechen Sie Deutsch ? Lots of people want to improve their German language skills but have no way to practice. At our monthly German Immersion Night , we provide a fun and festive environment for people who are learning German to socialize with other Germanophiles while enjoying German food and beverage (as you can see, that‚Äôs a lot of German going on!) This event is just perfect for brushing up on your greetings, ordering food and drinks, and learning new vocabulary from native speakers, including our staff! German Immersion Night began in March¬†and is held on the second Tuesday of every month. Join us for dinner, drinks, German chit-chat, and even an appearance by Orlando‚Äôs Schuhplattler Gruppe Alpenrose folk-dancing group. Not sure if this night is for you? Everyone has different reasons for learning a new language, but if you fall into any of the following categories, you will love German Immersion Night: You‚Äôre taking a trip to Germany Ah, lucky you! Germany is a beautiful country, and although most people there do speak English (and quite well!), the natives really appreciate it when visitors make an effort to speak their language. At Immersion Night, you can practice ordering in German and work on the pronunciation of different dishes and beers. Since many of our German-speaking staff will be working, you may even get some travel tips for the regions you plan to visit! You are in a German group or class Did you know that German is the third most popular language students take in school, right behind Spanish and French? Take a break from your formal language course with a little casual speaking practice! The more you speak, the more fluent your German will become, especially as you learn new idioms and turns of phrase that make your speech more natural and less stiff. Our staff and other German pros can clue you into new phrases and maybe even some (age appropriate) slang! You just started dating a German Is there a more noble reason to learn a language than love? Communicate with your Schatzi a little better by learning his or her native tongue! You can come to Immersion Night and pick up a few special phrases to impress your sweetheart, or bring him or her along so she can teach you herself while you enjoy a German date night. This is a great motivation to learn‚Ä¶just ask our server Troy! You ARE German and you want to help others Most German guests we‚Äôve met love to help us with our German language skills, teaching our staff new vocabulary and phrases. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear your voice at Immersion Night! The more German speakers, the better. We know that sometimes after living in the US for years, you start to speak English more than your mother tongue, but you can reverse that trend when you join us for this event, all while challenging German students to up their game. You can tell stories about your region of Germany, talk about your favorite German dishes, or even tell some German jokes! No matter your reason for joining us on German Immersion Night, we know you‚Äôll have a great time! The more participants we have, the more educational and fun the experience will be for everyone. You can email us or reach out through social media for additional questions. Please contact Reservations@Hollerbachs.com for parties of 6 people or more. Last week, Theo showed me a newsletter and Christmas postcard he gets every year from the Selbach-Oster people, and told me something I didn‚Äôt know: most of us associate Germany with white wines, like the Selbach Mosel Riesling selection we carry, but red wine ‚Äì Pinot Noir ( Sp√§tburgunder )¬†in particular ‚Äì is on the rise in Germany. In fact, Deutschland is now the world‚Äôs third-largest producer of Pinot Noir, behind France (where it originated, of course) and the USA. Even our friends at Selbach mentioned in their newsletter that they‚Äôve begun experimenting with Pinot Noir, though they haven‚Äôt bottled any yet. Our Willow Tree bar carries three Rotweine imported from Germany: Valckenberg Dornfelder (semi-sweet) Starling Castle Red (semi-sweet) Valckenberg Undone Pinot Noir ‚Äì which you can also find at our Magnolia Square Market True German Deli, along with these additional varieties: Affentaler Pinot Noir AOC Schaffhausen Hallauer Sp√§tlese Pinot Noir (Switzerland) Wild Senses Red Wine Grafen Repperg Lemberger Gartenzwerg P.S. ‚Äì For anyone interested, here‚Äôs a couple links with a little more background, written by people who know a lot more about wine than Garden Gnomes do: Financial Times Vinepair Author Hollerbachs Posted on January 12, 2018 January 12, 2018 Categories German Traditions Posts pagination Page 1 Page 2 ‚Ä¶ Page 125 Next page Willow Tree Cafe Magnolia Square Market Outfitters Order Online Catering Join the Team Oktoberfest 2017 Hollerbach's Blog at WordPress.com. That dream became a reality in 2001, when her parents bought Willow Tree Cafe. The restaurant was tiny then but has since ballooned with the success of the business. ‚ÄúThey actually bought the restaurant with 60 seats and six employees for $60,000,‚Äù Hollerbach said. ‚ÄúAnd of course, since then, we now have about 160 employees and see almost 10,000 guests a week between all of our businesses.‚Äù [ ADD YOUR BUSINESS TO THE FLORIDA FOODIE DIRECTORY ] Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant has since taken over a large portion of the building it sits in. The family has also expanded to have a market, selling baked goods and imported meats, and an outfitter full of authentic German costumes and outfits. In the more than 20 years since the restaurant first opened, Hollerbach has taken the reins of the business as its CEO. Hollerbach said the businesses are selling more than just food. They are selling a feeling of warmth and friendliness expressed best by the German word gem√ºtlichkeit. Find every episode of Florida Foodie on YouTube: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what we‚Äôre trying to achieve all the time for these guests,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs why people like to celebrate special occasions here because you get that energy and like yes, the food is a huge part of it because it adds to that experience, but it is just one part of it.‚Äù Part of that effort to provide a cozy experience is by offering something for everyone, including its main restaurant which mimics a German beer hall with live music, a lodge for more of a bar atmosphere and the upstairs restaurant, Uber Keller, which offers a more laid back experience and serves German tapas. Hollerback feels as though the restaurant has helped to drive some change in Sanford ‚Äî helping to take it from a sleepy suburb to a destination. ‚ÄúI would definitely consider us as a catalyst of making people believe that Sanford had a nightlife and a future because, you know, (the restaurant) was lunch only and we used to open for dinner on just Fridays and Saturdays and we would have like 10 covers. Now, there‚Äôs a line out the door,‚Äù she said. Hollerbach is very active in the community as well. She is an advocate for the city and works closely with the Sanford Main Street organization to push for improvements in the city. ‚ÄúI can still pause and appreciate and be grateful for what is happening right now while still simultaneously going ‚ÄòAlright, well, we got to fix this,‚Äù she said. On the latest episode of Florida Foodie, Hollerbach shares more of her family‚Äôs history and how it is woven into the fabric of the restaurant. SANFORD, Fla. ‚Äì Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant, the transformational force in Sanford, is set to open a new concept inside a nearby music venue. Burgerbach‚Äôs, a fast casual eatery, will open inside Tuffy‚Äôs Music Box and Lounge , according to a news release. The music venue is at 200 Myrtle Avenue, about a five-minute walk from Hollerbach‚Äôs. ‚ÄúWe are incredibly excited about this new chapter,‚Äù Hollerbach‚Äôs CEO Christina Hollerbach said in a prepared statement. ‚ÄúTuffy‚Äôs has always been a fantastic venue for live music and entertainment, and we are eager to complement that with our culinary offerings.‚Äù [EXCLUSIVE: Become a News 6 Insider (it‚Äôs FREE) | PINIT! Rather, Hollerbach‚Äôs Executive Chef Patrick Story has created an American menu, featuring Oklahoma-style smash burgers, chicken sandwiches and frozen treats, per the release. Meanwhile, the Hollerbach‚Äôs team will also create a menu for the tiki bar inside the music venue, called the Suffering Bastard . Specific menu items that will be served have not yet been released, but the news release said the food will be inspired by Hawaii. The opening date for Burgerbach‚Äôs has not been released, but Dan St. Pierre, owner of Tuffy‚Äôs, said he is excited about this collaboration as well. ‚ÄúTheir reputation for quality and community engagement aligns perfectly with our vision for Tuffy‚Äôs. Caregivers bear the weight of the disease, but a local organization called Dementia-Friendly Dining is hoping to lessen the load for caregivers and provide them with the opportunity to make memories with their loved ones while out to dinner. Dennis Dulniak, co-founder of Dementia-Friendly Dining, said the organization came to be because of his own experience with the illness. ‚ÄúI suffered through this with my wife, and it was with my wife where we created our first restaurant,‚Äù Dulniak said. ‚ÄúI was very, very proud that I could still take my wife out and enjoy that experience and I treasure those moments because I no longer have them.‚Äù [EXCLUSIVE: Become a News 6 Insider (it‚Äôs FREE) | PINIT! Share your photos ] So far, five Central Florida restaurants have signed up to provide Dementia-Friendly Dining, including the organization‚Äôs newest addition, Hollerbach‚Äôs in Sanford. Dulniak said when a restaurant decides to participate, their staff undergoes special training to be able to provide the dementia-friendly dining experience. ‚ÄúWe will have Hollerbach‚Äôs staff take them to their back area, their side room, to where there‚Äôs not so much attractions, noise, the music is off in that area, and we place the client ‚Äî the person with dementia ‚Äî with their back to the door so that their visuals are more focused on their loved one,‚Äù Dulniak said. ‚ÄúWe train the servers to establish great eye contact, a contagious smile, and focusing on the fact that we‚Äôre delivering quality service.‚Äù Chris Cremen, chief operating officer for Hollerbach‚Äôs German Restaurant, said the reaction was bigger than expected when they announced the restaurant would offer dementia-friendly dining. ‚ÄúEveryone kind of has a connection to dementia one way or another and that turns out very true,‚Äù Cremen said. ‚ÄúTons of our staff have been connected to people, and then our guests have already started asking questions about it, making connections with our staff through it so the ripple is already there.‚Äù Dementia-Friendly Dining‚Äôs other co-founder Toni Gitles said that being able to go out to dinner not only helps the patient, but the caregiver too. ‚ÄúGoing out to eat is a tradition in the United States,‚Äù Gitles said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs something that‚Äôs normal and it makes you feel normal when you‚Äôre able to do that and when you‚Äôre in a safe environment.‚Äù Hollerbach‚Äôs will begin offering dementia-friendly dining starting Monday, July 15, and every Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 3:00 to 5:00 p.m. Check out the Florida Foodie podcast.
